str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
